remarks: The transposition swaps the arguments in a two-argument function.  When ` F ` is a matrix, which is to say a function from ( 1 ... m ) ` X. ` ( 1 ... n ) to the reals or some ring, ` tpos F ` is the transposition of ` F ` , which is where the name comes from.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)
statement: ovtposg $p |- ( ( A e. V /\ B e. W ) -> ( A tpos F B ) = ( B F A ) ) $.
